segment.source: Testing Your Application Mitigation Packages (Windows 10)
segment.target: Testing Your Application Mitigation Packages (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic provides details about testing your application-mitigation packages, including recommendations about how to report your information and how to resolve any outstanding issues.
segment.target: This topic provides details about testing your application-mitigation packages, including recommendations about how to report your information and how to resolve any outstanding issues.

segment.source: Testing Your Application Mitigation Packages
segment.target: Testing Your Application Mitigation Packages

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: This topic provides details about testing your application-mitigation packages, including recommendations about how to report your information and how to resolve any outstanding issues.
segment.target: This topic provides details about testing your application-mitigation packages, including recommendations about how to report your information and how to resolve any outstanding issues.

segment.source: Testing Your Application Mitigation Packages
segment.target: Testing Your Application Mitigation Packages

segment.source: Testing your application mitigation package strategies is an iterative process, whereby the mitigation strategies that prove unsuccessful will need to be revised and retested.
segment.target: Testing your application mitigation package strategies is an iterative process, whereby the mitigation strategies that prove unsuccessful will need to be revised and retested.

segment.source: The testing process includes a series of tests in the test environment and one or more pilot deployments in the production environment.
segment.target: The testing process includes a series of tests in the test environment and one or more pilot deployments in the production environment.

segment.source: To test your mitigation strategies
segment.target: To test your mitigation strategies

segment.source: Perform the following steps for each of the applications for which you have developed mitigations.
segment.target: Perform the following steps for each of the applications for which you have developed mitigations.

segment.source: Test the mitigation strategy in your test environment.
segment.target: Test the mitigation strategy in your test environment.

segment.source: If the mitigation strategy is unsuccessful, revise the mitigation strategy and perform step 1 again.
segment.target: If the mitigation strategy is unsuccessful, revise the mitigation strategy and perform step 1 again.

segment.source: At the end of this step, you will have successfully tested all of your mitigation strategies in your test environment and can move to your pilot deployment environment.
segment.target: At the end of this step, you will have successfully tested all of your mitigation strategies in your test environment and can move to your pilot deployment environment.

segment.source: Perform the following steps in the pilot deployments for each of the applications for which you have developed mitigations.
segment.target: Perform the following steps in the pilot deployments for each of the applications for which you have developed mitigations.

segment.source: Test the mitigation strategy in your pilot deployment.
segment.target: Test the mitigation strategy in your pilot deployment.

segment.source: If the mitigation strategy is unsuccessful, revise the mitigation strategy and perform Step 2 again.
segment.target: If the mitigation strategy is unsuccessful, revise the mitigation strategy and perform Step 2 again.

segment.source: At the end of this step, you will have successfully tested all of your mitigation strategies in your pilot environment.
segment.target: At the end of this step, you will have successfully tested all of your mitigation strategies in your pilot environment.

segment.source: Reporting the Compatibility Mitigation Status to Stakeholders
segment.target: Reporting the Compatibility Mitigation Status to Stakeholders

segment.source: After testing your application mitigation package, you must communicate your status to the appropriate stakeholders before deployment begins.
segment.target: After testing your application mitigation package, you must communicate your status to the appropriate stakeholders before deployment begins.

segment.source: We recommend that you perform this communication by using the following status ratings.
segment.target: We recommend that you perform this communication by using the following status ratings.

segment.source: Resolved application compatibility issues.
segment.target: Resolved application compatibility issues.

segment.source: This status indicates that the application compatibility issues are resolved and that these applications represent no risk to your environment.
segment.target: This status indicates that the application compatibility issues are resolved and that these applications represent no risk to your environment.

segment.source: Unresolved application compatibility issues.
segment.target: Unresolved application compatibility issues.

segment.source: This status indicates that there are unresolved issues for the specifically defined applications.
segment.target: This status indicates that there are unresolved issues for the specifically defined applications.

segment.source: Because these applications are a risk to your environment, more discussion is required before you can resolve the compatibility issues.
segment.target: Because these applications are a risk to your environment, more discussion is required before you can resolve the compatibility issues.

segment.source: Changes to user experience.
segment.target: Changes to user experience.

segment.source: This status indicates that the fix will change the user experience for the defined applications, possibly requiring your staff to receive further training.
segment.target: This status indicates that the fix will change the user experience for the defined applications, possibly requiring your staff to receive further training.

segment.source: More investigation is required before you can resolve the compatibility issues.
segment.target: More investigation is required before you can resolve the compatibility issues.

segment.source: Changes in help desk procedures and processes.
segment.target: Changes in help desk procedures and processes.

segment.source: This status indicates that the fix will require changes to your help desk's procedures and processes, possibly requiring your support staff to receive further training.
segment.target: This status indicates that the fix will require changes to your help desk's procedures and processes, possibly requiring your support staff to receive further training.

segment.source: More investigation is required before you can resolve the compatibility issues.
segment.target: More investigation is required before you can resolve the compatibility issues.

segment.source: Resolving Outstanding Compatibility Issues
segment.target: Resolving Outstanding Compatibility Issues

segment.source: At this point, you probably cannot resolve any unresolved application compatibility issues by automated mitigation methods or by modifying the application.
segment.target: At this point, you probably cannot resolve any unresolved application compatibility issues by automated mitigation methods or by modifying the application.

segment.source: Resolve any outstanding application compatibility issues by using one of the following methods.
segment.target: Resolve any outstanding application compatibility issues by using one of the following methods.

segment.source: Apply specific compatibility modes, or run the program as an Administrator, by using the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: Apply specific compatibility modes, or run the program as an Administrator, by using the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more information about using Compatibility Administrator to apply compatibility fixes and compatibility modes, see Using the Compatibility Administrator Tool.
segment.target: For more information about using Compatibility Administrator to apply compatibility fixes and compatibility modes, see Using the Compatibility Administrator Tool.

segment.source: Run the application in a virtual environment.
segment.target: Run the application in a virtual environment.

segment.source: Run the application in a version of Windows supported by the application in a virtualized environment.
segment.target: Run the application in a version of Windows supported by the application in a virtualized environment.

segment.source: This method ensures application compatibility, because the application is running on a supported operating system.
segment.target: This method ensures application compatibility, because the application is running on a supported operating system.

segment.source: Resolve application compatibility by using non-Microsoft tools.
segment.target: Resolve application compatibility by using non-Microsoft tools.

segment.source: If the application was developed in an environment other than Microsoft Visual Studio®, you must use non-Microsoft debugging and analysis tools to help resolve the remaining application compatibility issues.
segment.target: If the application was developed in an environment other than Microsoft Visual Studio®, you must use non-Microsoft debugging and analysis tools to help resolve the remaining application compatibility issues.

segment.source: Outsource the application compatibility mitigation.
segment.target: Outsource the application compatibility mitigation.

segment.source: If your developers have insufficient resources to resolve the application compatibility issues, outsource the mitigation effort to another organization within your company.
segment.target: If your developers have insufficient resources to resolve the application compatibility issues, outsource the mitigation effort to another organization within your company.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Managing Application-Compatibility Fixes and Custom Fix Databases
